info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 6:26PM MST until August 11 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 626 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain had ended in the Kingman area. However, water from earlier torrential rain was still flowing, so the Flash Flood Warning remains in effect. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kingman, Hualapai Mountain Park, Wild Cow Campground, New Kingman-Butler, Hualapai Peak, and the Flag Fire burn scar. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
